How can we solve this?

kr

NIco

entry.title: 外貨で赤黒合計0円の自動支払処理をする際に、支払が分かれてしまう
entry.content:
事象概要

自動支払処理（F110）において、同一仕入先に対する外貨建ての請求伝票（黒伝票）と貸方伝票（赤伝票）を同額で相殺した場合、本来は 0 金額で相殺されることを期待しているが、支払提案処理では支払が分割されて提案されてしまう。

詳細条件

  • トランザクション：F110（自動支払処理）

  • 通貨：SGD（他の外貨でも同様に発生）

  • 伝票条件：

    • 請求伝票（黒伝票）：100 SGD

    • クレジットメモ（赤伝票）：–100 SGD

    • 支払方法、銀行キー、会社コード、支払通貨などは一致

  • 円貨（JPY）の場合：

    • 同様のケースでは支払提案がまとまり、0 支払として処理可能

結果

  • 外貨の場合のみ、支払提案にて支払が分割される

期待動作

  • 外貨建ての場合も円貨と同様に、赤伝票と黒伝票の合計が 0 になる場合は一括で相殺され、支払が分割されないこと

補足

  • 伝票条件（支払方法、銀行キー、通貨など）は一致していることを確認済み

  • 内貨（JPY）では問題なく 0 支払として消し込まれることを確認済み

  • 外貨のみで POKEN フラグが立つため、これが原因と推測しているが、なぜ外貨のみこの挙動となるのか不明

Issue Summary

In the Automatic Payment Program (F110), when offsetting a foreign currency vendor invoice (debit/black line item) against a credit memo (credit/red line item) for the same vendor with exactly the same amount, it is expected that the payment proposal will net to zero and no payment will be generated. However, in the payment proposal, the items are split and treated as separate payments.

Detailed Conditions

  • Transaction: F110 (Automatic Payment Program)

  • Currency: SGD (the same behavior occurs with other foreign currencies as well)

  • Document conditions:

    • Invoice (debit/black): 100 SGD

    • Credit memo (credit/red): –100 SGD

    • Payment method, house bank, company code, and payment currency are identical between the two documents

  • Behavior in local currency (JPY):

    • In similar cases in JPY, the payment proposal correctly nets the items together, resulting in a zero payment which can be processed without splitting

Actual Result

  • Only in the case of foreign currency, the payment proposal splits the items into separate payments

  • In the proposal log, the flag REGUE-POKEN (item-level payment indicator) is set, causing the items to be treated as individual payments

Expected Behavior

  • Even for foreign currency, when the invoice and the credit memo net to zero, the items should be grouped together in the payment proposal and no payment should be generated

  • The behavior should be consistent with local currency (JPY)

Additional Notes

  • All document conditions (payment method, house bank, currency, etc.) are confirmed to be identical

  • In local currency (JPY), zero payments are handled correctly

  • The POKEN flag is only set in foreign currency cases, which seems to be the root cause, but it is unclear why this happens only for foreign currencies

entry.title: Payment term block issue
entry.content:
Dear Gurus and Experts 

As per requirement from business .PAYMENT TERM (Z888)need to be blocked.

But condition is that, it should not impact invoices for which payments are due. Means it should be done for future  payments not for one for which invoice already done with mentioned payment term(Z888)

And it should not impact POs for which GRN already been done and INVOICE posting payment are due with reference to mentioned payment term.

And in future while creating PO mentioned payment term (Z888) should not appeared (although we can not delete payment term as its master data creation)

Reply awaited

Thanks and Regards,

Aman Jain

FIN (Finance) MM Invoice Verification FIN Accounts Receivable and Payable

entry.title: Discrepancy in TDS Deduction During CN Booking
entry.content:
Hello All,
I hope this message finds you well.
I would like to bring to your attention a discrepancy observed during the booking of a Credit Note (CN) in DHL Express (160086) related to FY 2024-25. The CN was created due to an invoice initially booked with an incorrect GST head.

However, during the CN booking in SAP, TDS was deducted at 2%, whereas, at the time of the original invoice booking, SAP had deducted TDS at 1.35% as per the applicable Lower Deduction Certificate (LDC).

Kindly review this discrepancy and advise on the necessary steps to align the TDS treatment correctly in the system.

Looking forward to your prompt response.

entry.title: TDS Threshold Limit in SAP Based on PAN Number
entry.content:
Hi All,

I would like to request the implementation of a TDS (Tax Deducted at Source) threshold limit in our SAP system, specifically linked to the PAN (Permanent Account Number) of vendors.

Currently, TDS is being deducted without considering the individual threshold limits applicable to each PAN, which may lead to incorrect deductions or compliance issues. By configuring the threshold limit in SAP based on PAN, we can ensure:

  • Accurate and compliant TDS deductions

  • Improved vendor management and reconciliation

  • Streamlined tax reporting and auditing processes

Understanding the Requirement

  • Threshold: TDS should be deducted only if the payment/transaction crosses ₹50,00,000.

How can we implement this, Please help.

Basically user want tds apply only  if the payment/transaction crosses ₹50,00,000 even it updated in Vendor master.

Please help.

entry.title: How to Include Overhead Costs in Product Costing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I’m currently working on a costing scenario in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and I would like your insights.

My situation is as follows:

  • I want to produce a Finished Good (FG) along with a Co-Product.

  • I have already generated the BOM of the FG, which contains the cost of each component.

  • I created the Work Center, assigned each Activity Type (Setup, Machine Time, Personnel Time), and determined the price of each activity type.

  • When I create the Cost Estimate of the product, I can see the direct material costs (from BOM) and the direct production costs (from activity types).

👉 However, what I cannot see are the overhead costs (such as administration, sales, and other indirect costs).

My question to the community is:

  • How can I generate those overhead costs in the cost estimate within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

  • Which configuration steps do I need to follow?

  • Which applications (Fiori apps) are used to set this up and run the process?

Any guidance, best practices, or resources would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: How the cost estimation will happen in Campaign orders
entry.content:
I am creating a campaign in PCA1 and adding normal orders with cleanout orders in it. 
Created 3 production version
1. Planning - one recipe and BOM which has all activities and materials needed for both production and cleanout.
2. Production - Has another recipe and BOM with only the activities and materials necessary for producing one batch.
3. Clean out order - Has activities and materials necessary for cleaning (water, solvents, electricity, labor). Will have separate recipe group
Here I need to understand how the standard cost estimate will happen.
Do we need costing done for all Production versions. In standard it allows Standard costing for only one production version.
If costing done only for planning version, will there be no actual cost in Production & Cleanout orders?
Do all the actual cost will be settled as variance.
If so all the cost from cleanout and production order will be settled as variance and loss?
What is the normal business process to handle this.

entry.title: Regroup Receivables / Payables - exchange rate issue in sap S/4HANA public cloud
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

We are using Regroup Receivables / Payables in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

while regrouping receivables more than 1 year old open items,  current month exchange rate is being selected for regroup posting, instead of exchange rate from actual invoice posting date.

But the receivables less than 1 year old open items, actual invoice posting date exchange rate is being selected for regroup posting.

Is this the standard behavior for more than 1 year old open items while regrouping?

Kindly let me know.

Thank you.

Regards,

Shrinivas
